Package algorithms.imageProcessing.features

Class NextCorner<T extends CornerRegion>

java.lang.Object
algorithms.imageProcessing.features.NextCorner<T>
public class NextCorner<T extends CornerRegion> extends Object
A class to serve the purpose of an adjacency matrix (via rules to choose the "neighbor corner") and the state of "un-visited" for the search algorithm.
Author:
nichole

    A list of indexes to origCorners carrying corner regions from the curve, that is, closed curve edge, given to the corner matcher.

  • Field Details

    • origCorners

      protected final TreeSet<T extends CornerRegion> origCorners
      a list of corners extracted from a closed curve in a digital image

    • remainingCorners

      protected final TreeSet<T extends CornerRegion> remainingCorners
      A list of indexes to origCorners carrying corner regions from the curve, that is, closed curve edge, given to the corner matcher. Note that the lists are ordered by descending peak sigma. Note also that the List indexes are referred to as corner indexes.

    • matchedStats

      protected final List<FeatureComparisonStat> matchedStats

      public T findStrongestRemainingCorner()

    • findTheNextSmallestUnvisitedSibling

      public T findTheNextSmallestUnvisitedSibling(T target)
      find the next smallest sigma peak out of all contours. Note that this method has the side effect of removing the returned contour from the internal look-up data structures.
      Parameters:
      target - the contour or which to find the next smallest contour
      Returns:
